p: The administration of intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) is a therapeutic option in patients with severe/refractory PV ( 28). Since IVIg might be the safest immunomodulator for long-term use in all age groups ( 29), treatment with IVIg has been proposed as a potential option for COVID-19 ( 6) but data are scarce and controversial. In pemphigus patients with COVID-19 and flare of PV, this therapeutic option can be considered but should be weighed against possible side effects such s thromboembolism in severely ill patients ( 30).
